definitions.definition: a large wild animal of the dog family, that lives and hunts in groups

examples.text: She compared the media to a pack of ravening/ravenous wolves.
A lone wolf howled under the full moon.
Labour groups are often seen as the big bad wolf.
a story of a young boy raised by wolves

definitions.definition: to call for help when you do not need it, with the result that when you do need it people do not believe you
to have enough money to avoid going hungry; to stop somebody feeling hungry
a person who prefers to be alone
to leave somebody to be roughly treated or criticized without trying to help or defend them
a person who seems to be friendly or not likely to cause any harm but is really an enemy

wordOrigin: Old English wulf, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wolf and German Wolf, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin lupus and Greek lukos. The verb dates from the mid 19th cent.
